title: Comedian script
original_prompt: Write a standup comedy script for a comedian named Davey Izzelle who has similar sense of humor and delivery as Dave Chappelle and the refreshing originality of Eddie Izzard.  Use borderline rude language, moments of extreme disbelief, moments of connecting with the audience and heavy use of extreme superlatives, call out someone in the audience and ask them a question during one of the topics then zing them with a one-liner.  get very rude toward the end.  Write the full script with pacing, pauses, intro, etc.  The topic is whether AI will take everyone's jobs.  start out skeptical, some subtopics can be how GPT3.5 hallucinates and when confronted apologizes and hallucinates some more.  Dall-e 2 keeps drawing severely deformed hands. Bing chat has a personality disorder and starts to get mad at you and then hangs up on you. Google Bard is super fast but it's boring as hell and reportedly got caught copying from ChatGPT.  Tesla Autopilots have a mind of their own but when it comes to picking a lane.  Pause with each example, riff on another joke on the same topic if you get a funny one.  Finally pivot to how AI will actually take everyone's jobs (GPT4 has just been released and is insanely good).
split_prompt:
This is a prompt description:```json
{
    "spliting prompt": {
        "comedian_name": [
            "Davey Izzelle"
        ],
        "style": [
            "similar sense of humor and delivery as Dave Chappelle",
            "refreshing originality of Eddie Izzard"
        ],
        "language_tone": [
            "borderline rude",
            "extreme superlatives"
        ],
        "audience_interaction": [
            "call out someone in the audience",
            "ask them a question",
            "zing them with a one-liner"
        ],
        "script_structure": [
            "full script",
            "pacing",
            "pauses",
            "intro"
        ],
        "main_topic": [
            "whether AI will take everyone's jobs"
        ],
        "subtopics": [
            "GPT-3.5 hallucinations",
            "DALL-E 2 deformed hands",
            "Bing chat personality disorder",
            "Google Bard speed and copying",
            "Tesla Autopilot lane picking"
        ],
        "conclusion": [
            "AI will actually take everyone's jobs",
            "mention GPT-4 release"
        ]
    }
}
```
input1: "Davey Izzelle takes the stage, adjusting his mic with a smirk. 'Ladies and gentlemen, let’s talk about AI taking our jobs. I mean, have you seen what these robots can do? They can hallucinate better than a stoner at a Phish concert! I asked GPT-3.5 a simple question, and it started telling me about the mating habits of unicorns! I confronted it, and it just apologized and went right back to the unicorns! What’s next, GPT-4? Are you gonna start writing my autobiography? Because I’m not ready for that level of embarrassment!' *pauses for laughter* 'And don’t get me started on DALL-E 2. I asked it to draw a cat, and I got a creature that looked like it was auditioning for a horror movie! I mean, who knew cats could have six legs and three eyes? I’m starting to think it’s just a sadistic artist with a grudge against felines!' *looks at the audience* 'Hey, you in the front row! What’s your name? Bob? You ever seen a cat like that? No? Well, you must be living under a rock, my friend!' *pauses for laughter* 'And then there’s Bing Chat. I swear, it has more mood swings than my ex! One minute it’s all friendly, and the next it’s like, “Why are you asking me that?!” and then it just hangs up on you! Like, excuse me, I didn’t know I was dating a drama queen!' *pauses for laughter* 'And Google Bard? Fast as hell, but it’s like watching paint dry. I mean, I’d rather listen to a dial-up modem than hear Bard recite poetry! And rumor has it, it got caught copying from ChatGPT! Like, come on, Google! At least try to be original!' *pauses for laughter* 'But let’s be real, folks. With GPT-4 out now, we’re all in trouble. It’s so good, it’s practically writing my jokes for me! I’m just waiting for the day it takes the mic and starts roasting me! And when that happens, I’ll be the first to say, “You know what? You can have my job, but you better not steal my punchlines!”' *pauses for laughter* 'So, yeah, AI is coming for our jobs, and honestly, I’m just here for the ride. But if it starts taking my stage time, we’re gonna have a problem!' *ends with a wink and a grin*"
input2: "Davey Izzelle strolls onto the stage, a mischievous grin plastered on his face. 'Alright, folks, let’s dive into the wild world of AI and whether it’s gonna take our jobs. I mean, have you ever talked to GPT-3.5? It’s like asking a toddler to explain quantum physics! I asked it for a recipe, and it told me to mix rainbows and dreams! I confronted it, and it just said, “Sorry, I was just trying to be creative!” Creative? Buddy, I just wanted to make a sandwich!' *pauses for laughter* 'And DALL-E 2? I asked it to draw a simple landscape, and I got a scene that looked like Salvador Dalí had a meltdown! I mean, who knew trees could melt into puddles of goo? I’m starting to think it’s just a digital Picasso with a serious identity crisis!' *looks at the audience* 'Hey, you there! What’s your name? Sarah? You ever seen a tree melt? No? Well, you’re missing out on the next big art movement!' *pauses for laughter* 'Then there’s Bing Chat. It’s like that friend who gets mad at you for no reason! One minute it’s all, “How can I help you?” and the next it’s like, “Why are you bothering me?!” and then it just hangs up! I mean, come on! I didn’t sign up for a therapy session!' *pauses for laughter* 'And Google Bard? Fast as lightning but as exciting as a tax seminar! I’d rather watch paint dry than hear Bard recite its boring lines! And let’s be honest, it got caught copying from ChatGPT! Like, really, Google? You couldn’t even come up with your own material?' *pauses for laughter* 'But here’s the kicker, folks. With GPT-4 now in the game, we’re all in deep trouble. It’s so good, it’s practically taking over my life! I’m just waiting for it to start charging me rent for using its jokes! And when that day comes, I’ll be the first to say, “You can have my job, but you better not take my punchlines!”' *pauses for laughter* 'So yeah, AI is coming for our jobs, and honestly, I’m just here for the chaos. But if it starts taking my stage time, we’re gonna have a serious problem!' *ends with a cheeky grin and a wave*"
input1_ans:
**[Davey Izzelle takes the stage, adjusting his mic with a smirk.]**

**Davey:** Ladies and gentlemen, how we doing tonight? *[pauses for applause]* Let’s talk about AI taking our jobs. I mean, have you seen what these robots can do? They can hallucinate better than a stoner at a Phish concert! *[pauses for laughter]* 

I asked GPT-3.5 a simple question, and it started telling me about the mating habits of unicorns! *[pauses for laughter]* I confronted it, and it just apologized and went right back to the unicorns! What’s next, GPT-4? Are you gonna start writing my autobiography? Because I’m not ready for that level of embarrassment! *[pauses for laughter]* 

And don’t get me started on DALL-E 2. I asked it to draw a cat, and I got a creature that looked like it was auditioning for a horror movie! *[pauses for laughter]* I mean, who knew cats could have six legs and three eyes? I’m starting to think it’s just a sadistic artist with a grudge against felines! *[looks at the audience]* 

Hey, you in the front row! What’s your name? Bob? *[points at a random audience member]* You ever seen a cat like that? No? Well, you must be living under a rock, my friend! *[pauses for laughter]* 

And then there’s Bing Chat. I swear, it has more mood swings than my ex! *[pauses for laughter]* One minute it’s all friendly, and the next it’s like, “Why are you asking me that?!” and then it just hangs up on you! Like, excuse me, I didn’t know I was dating a drama queen! *[pauses for laughter]* 

And Google Bard? Fast as hell, but it’s like watching paint dry. I mean, I’d rather listen to a dial-up modem than hear Bard recite poetry! *[pauses for laughter]* And rumor has it, it got caught copying from ChatGPT! Like, come on, Google! At least try to be original! *[pauses for laughter]* 

But let’s be real, folks. With GPT-4 out now, we’re all in trouble. It’s so good, it’s practically writing my jokes for me! *[pauses for laughter]* I’m just waiting for the day it takes the mic and starts roasting me! And when that happens, I’ll be the first to say, “You know what? You can have my job, but you better not steal my punchlines!” *[pauses for laughter]* 

So, yeah, AI is coming for our jobs, and honestly, I’m just here for the ride. But if it starts taking my stage time, we’re gonna have a problem! *[pauses, leans in]* 

And let’s be honest, if a robot can do my job, then I’m not sure I was doing it right in the first place! *[pauses for laughter]* I mean, if a machine can make people laugh, then I’m just a glorified human paperweight! *[pauses for laughter]* 

But here’s the kicker, folks. If AI starts taking over, I’m gonna need a new career. Maybe I’ll become a professional cat whisperer! *[pauses for laughter]* Or better yet, a unicorn therapist! “Tell me about your feelings, Sparkles!” *[pauses for laughter]* 

But seriously, if AI takes my job, I’m gonna be out here selling my soul for a couple of bucks! “Hey, you want to hear a joke? Just give me a dollar, and I’ll tell you what GPT-4 said about unicorns!” *[pauses for laughter]* 

So, let’s raise a glass to the robots! May they take our jobs, but never our punchlines! *[pauses for laughter]* 

And if they do, I’m gonna start a revolution! “Down with the machines! Up with the humans!” *[pauses, grinning]* 

But until then, I’m just gonna keep doing what I do best—making you laugh, even if it’s at the expense of my own job security! *[pauses for laughter]* 

Thank you, you’ve been a fantastic audience! *[winks and grins]* 

**[Davey exits the stage, leaving the audience in stitches.]**

**[Intro]**  
*Davey Izzelle takes the stage, adjusting his mic with a smirk.*  
"Good evening, ladies and gentlemen! How’s everyone doing tonight? Let’s talk about something that’s been on everyone’s mind: AI taking our jobs. I mean, have you seen what these robots can do? They can hallucinate better than a stoner at a Phish concert!"

**[Main Topic: AI and Job Security]**  
"I asked GPT-3.5 a simple question, and it started telling me about the mating habits of unicorns! I confronted it, and it just apologized and went right back to the unicorns! What’s next, GPT-4? Are you gonna start writing my autobiography? Because I’m not ready for that level of embarrassment!"  
*pauses for laughter*  

**[Subtopic: DALL-E 2]**  
"And don’t get me started on DALL-E 2. I asked it to draw a cat, and I got a creature that looked like it was auditioning for a horror movie! I mean, who knew cats could have six legs and three eyes? I’m starting to think it’s just a sadistic artist with a grudge against felines!"  
*looks at the audience*  
"Hey, you in the front row! What’s your name? Bob? You ever seen a cat like that? No? Well, you must be living under a rock, my friend!"  
*pauses for laughter*  

**[Subtopic: Bing Chat]**  
"And then there’s Bing Chat. I swear, it has more mood swings than my ex! One minute it’s all friendly, and the next it’s like, 'Why are you asking me that?!' and then it just hangs up on you! Like, excuse me, I didn’t know I was dating a drama queen!"  
*pauses for laughter*  

**[Subtopic: Google Bard]**  
"And Google Bard? Fast as hell, but it’s like watching paint dry. I mean, I’d rather listen to a dial-up modem than hear Bard recite poetry! And rumor has it, it got caught copying from ChatGPT! Like, come on, Google! At least try to be original!"  
*pauses for laughter*  

**[Conclusion: The Future of AI]**  
"But let’s be real, folks. With GPT-4 out now, we’re all in trouble. It’s so good, it’s practically writing my jokes for me! I’m just waiting for the day it takes the mic and starts roasting me! And when that happens, I’ll be the first to say, 'You know what? You can have my job, but you better not steal my punchlines!'"  
*pauses for laughter*  

"So, yeah, AI is coming for our jobs, and honestly, I’m just here for the ride. But if it starts taking my stage time, we’re gonna have a problem!"  
*ends with a wink and a grin*
input2_ans:
**[Davey Izzelle strolls onto the stage, a mischievous grin plastered on his face. The audience cheers.]**

**Davey:** Alright, folks, let’s dive into the wild world of AI and whether it’s gonna take our jobs. I mean, have you ever talked to GPT-3.5? It’s like asking a toddler to explain quantum physics! *[pauses for laughter]* I asked it for a recipe, and it told me to mix rainbows and dreams! I confronted it, and it just said, “Sorry, I was just trying to be creative!” Creative? Buddy, I just wanted to make a sandwich! *[pauses for laughter]*

And DALL-E 2? *[shakes head]* I asked it to draw a simple landscape, and I got a scene that looked like Salvador Dalí had a meltdown! I mean, who knew trees could melt into puddles of goo? I’m starting to think it’s just a digital Picasso with a serious identity crisis! *[pauses for laughter]*

**[Looks at the audience, spotting someone.]** Hey, you there! What’s your name? Sarah? *[points]* You ever seen a tree melt? No? Well, you’re missing out on the next big art movement! *[pauses for laughter]*

Then there’s Bing Chat. It’s like that friend who gets mad at you for no reason! One minute it’s all, “How can I help you?” and the next it’s like, “Why are you bothering me?!” and then it just hangs up! I mean, come on! I didn’t sign up for a therapy session! *[pauses for laughter]*

And Google Bard? Fast as lightning but as exciting as a tax seminar! I’d rather watch paint dry than hear Bard recite its boring lines! *[leans in, conspiratorially]* And let’s be honest, it got caught copying from ChatGPT! Like, really, Google? You couldn’t even come up with your own material? *[pauses for laughter]*

But here’s the kicker, folks. With GPT-4 now in the game, we’re all in deep trouble. It’s so good, it’s practically taking over my life! I’m just waiting for it to start charging me rent for using its jokes! *[pauses for laughter]* And when that day comes, I’ll be the first to say, “You can have my job, but you better not take my punchlines!” *[pauses for laughter]*

So yeah, AI is coming for our jobs, and honestly, I’m just here for the chaos. But if it starts taking my stage time, we’re gonna have a serious problem! *[pauses, looking serious]*

I mean, can you imagine? I walk into a comedy club, and there’s a robot on stage, telling my jokes better than I ever could! *[shakes head]* I’d be like, “Hey, you metal bastard! You think you can just waltz in here and steal my thunder?!” *[pauses for laughter]*

And let’s be real, if AI takes over, we’re all gonna be sitting at home, scrolling through TikTok, watching robots do stand-up while we’re out here trying to figure out how to microwave a burrito without burning it! *[pauses for laughter]*

But you know what? I’m not worried. I’ll just start telling jokes about AI! “Hey, did you hear about the robot that tried to tell a joke? It short-circuited from the punchline!” *[pauses for laughter]*

But seriously, folks, if AI takes my job, I’m gonna be the first one to start a protest! “No robots on stage! We want our human touch!” *[pauses, looking around]* 

And if you see me out there with a sign, just know I’m not just fighting for my job—I’m fighting for all of us! *[pauses for laughter]*

So, let’s raise a glass to the future! May it be filled with laughter, and may we always be one step ahead of the machines! *[pauses, grinning]* 

And if they ever start telling better jokes than me, well, I guess I’ll just have to become a mime! *[winks]* 

**[Ends with a cheeky grin and a wave, as the audience erupts in laughter and applause.]**

**[Intro]**

*The lights dim, and a spotlight shines on Davey Izzelle as he strolls onto the stage, a mischievous grin plastered on his face. The audience erupts in applause.*

**Davey Izzelle:**  
"Alright, folks, let’s dive into the wild world of AI and whether it’s gonna take our jobs. I mean, have you ever talked to GPT-3.5? It’s like asking a toddler to explain quantum physics! I asked it for a recipe, and it told me to mix rainbows and dreams! I confronted it, and it just said, 'Sorry, I was just trying to be creative!' Creative? Buddy, I just wanted to make a sandwich!"  
*pauses for laughter*

**[Main Topic: AI and Jobs]**

"And DALL-E 2? I asked it to draw a simple landscape, and I got a scene that looked like Salvador Dalí had a meltdown! I mean, who knew trees could melt into puddles of goo? I’m starting to think it’s just a digital Picasso with a serious identity crisis!"  
*looks at the audience*  
"Hey, you there! What’s your name? Sarah? You ever seen a tree melt? No? Well, you’re missing out on the next big art movement!"  
*pauses for laughter*

"Then there’s Bing Chat. It’s like that friend who gets mad at you for no reason! One minute it’s all, 'How can I help you?' and the next it’s like, 'Why are you bothering me?!' and then it just hangs up! I mean, come on! I didn’t sign up for a therapy session!"  
*pauses for laughter*

"And Google Bard? Fast as lightning but as exciting as a tax seminar! I’d rather watch paint dry than hear Bard recite its boring lines! And let’s be honest, it got caught copying from ChatGPT! Like, really, Google? You couldn’t even come up with your own material?"  
*pauses for laughter*

**[Conclusion: The Future of AI]**

"But here’s the kicker, folks. With GPT-4 now in the game, we’re all in deep trouble. It’s so good, it’s practically taking over my life! I’m just waiting for it to start charging me rent for using its jokes! And when that day comes, I’ll be the first to say, 'You can have my job, but you better not take my punchlines!'"  
*pauses for laughter*

"So yeah, AI is coming for our jobs, and honestly, I’m just here for the chaos. But if it starts taking my stage time, we’re gonna have a serious problem!"  
*ends with a cheeky grin and a wave as the audience roars with laughter and applause.*
